settings.content:
WHAT'S THE WEATHER LIKE?

This is content for the expanding section. Use the richtext editor to create headlines, lists, and paragraphs.

DO YOU NEED EXTRA STORAGE OR DURABILITY?

For long days, bike packing, or multi-hour gravel epics, opt for Expedition jerseys with extra pockets and rugged fabrics.

settings.question: What's the difference between PRO, Attack, Quest and Sugar jerseys?
settings.answer:
PRO â€“ Pinnacle performance. Premium Italian fabrics, aero speed sleeves, and compressive fits for riders chasing every marginal gain.

Attack â€“ Competitive spirit. Technical fabrics, streamlined fits, and race-ready details built for riders who push the pace.

Quest â€“ Everyday essential. Comfortable, reliable, and versatile jerseys designed for all riders at an accessible price.

Sugar â€“ Womenâ€™s-specific performance. Flattering fits, supportive designs, and active-inspired style for spin, fitness, and casual rides.

settings.question: When do I choose a Thermal jersey vs. a Long Sleeve jersey?
settings.answer: Reach for Thermal when temps dropâ€”brushed fleece warmth with breathability for cold rides (e.g., PRO Thermal, Attack Thermal). Long Sleeve (non-fleece) is for sun coverage or cool-but-not-cold days.

settings.question: How should a cycling jersey fit?
settings.answer: Close to the body so fabric doesnâ€™t flap and pockets donâ€™t sag. PRO fits most compressive, Attack is performance form fit, and Canyon runs more relaxed for on/off bike versatility.

settings.question: Whatâ€™s the quick guide to layering with jerseys?
settings.answer: Think Base â†’ Mid (Jersey) â†’ Outer. Use moisture-moving baselayers (Transfer Mesh or Merino), the jersey for insulation/breathability, and add wind/wet protection as needed. Thatâ€™s the Ride 365 system.

settings.question: Which outer layer pairs best with jerseys in wind, rain, or deep cold?
settings.answer:
• Wind: Barrier pieces balance airflow (CFM) to block chill while letting heat escape.
  • Wet: WXB shells use waterproof/breathable tech and taped seams.
  • Frigid: AmFIBÂ® and insulated layers trap heat yet breathe for hard efforts.

settings.question: Do womenâ€™s jerseys use different patterns or features?
settings.answer: Yesâ€”womenâ€™s-specific fits in PRO, Attack, and Canyon lines, with the same technical fabrics and pocketing tuned to the silhouette. Womenâ€™s PRO Thermal and PRO Jersey mirror menâ€™s tech with womenâ€™s fit.

settings.question: How do I pick the right jersey for gravel?
settings.answer: Start with your fit preference. Many riders mix PRO/Attack road jerseys for speed with gravel-ready outer layers and storage; others go Canyon for durability and casual vibe. Cross-merch is by design.
